channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Groups with a Fixed Character Degree
item.description: arXiv:2411.08581v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $G$ be a finite group, and let $d$ be the degree of an irreducible character of $G$ such that $|G|=d(d+e)$ for some $e>1$. Consider the case when $G$ is solvable, $d$ is square-free, and $(d,d+e)=1$. We wish to explore an equivalent condition on $G$ when $d\in\text{cd}(G)$. We show that if $d\in\text{cd}(G)$ then there is a sequence of congruences relating the prime power factors of $d+e$ to the product of prime factors of $d$ such that the product of the moduli in this sequence of congruences is $d$. Moreover, the argument will hold in both directions.
item.dc:creator: Mark L. Lewis, Brandon Martin

item.title: Absolutely irreducible quasisimple linear groups containing elements of order a specified Zsigmondy prime
item.description: arXiv:2411.08270v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper is concerned with absolutely irreducible quasisimple subgroups $G$ of a finite general linear group $GL_d(\mathbb{F}_q)$ for which some element $g\in G$ of prime order $r$, in its action on the natural module $V=(\mathbb{F}_q)^d$, is irreducible on a subspace of the form $V(1-g)$ of dimension $d/2$. We classify $G,d,r$, the characteristic $p$ of the field $\mathbb{F}_q$, and we identify those examples where the element $g$ has a fixed point subspace of dimension $d/2$. Our proof relies on representation theory, in particular, the multiplicities of eigenvalues of $g$, and builds on earlier results of DiMuro.
item.dc:creator: S. P. Glasby, Alice C. Niemeyer, Cheryl E. Praeger, A. E. Zalesski

item.title: On the Euler characteristics for quandles
item.description: arXiv:2411.08319v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: A quandle is an algebraic system whose axioms generalize the algebraic structure of the point symmetries of symmetric spaces. In this paper, we give a definition of Euler characteristics for quandles. In particular, the quandle Euler characteristic of a compact connected Riemannian symmetric space coincides with the topological Euler characteristic. Additionally, we calculate the Euler characteristics of some finite quandles, including generalized Alexander quandles, core quandles, discrete spheres, and discrete tori. Furthermore, we prove several properties of quandle Euler characteristics, which suggest that they share similar properties with topological Euler characteristics.
item.dc:creator: Ryoya Kai, Hiroshi Tamaru

item.title: Categorical characterisations of quasi-isometric embeddings
item.description: arXiv:2411.08501v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We characterise the (closeness classes of) quasi-isometric embeddings as the regular monomorphisms in the coarsely Lipschitz category, formalising the notion that they are isomorphisms onto their image. Furthermore, we prove that the coarsely Lipschitz category is coregular, and hence admits an (Epi, RegMono)--orthogonal factorisation system. Consequently, quasi-isometric embeddings are equivalently characterised as the effective, strong, or extremal monomorphisms. Finally, we prove that the coarsely Lipschitz category is not coexact in the sense of Barr.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tang

item.title: The Word Problem for $(\omega - 1)$-Terms over $\boldsymbol{\mathrm{DAb}}$
item.description: arXiv:2411.08523v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a ranker-based description using finite-index congruences for the variety $\boldsymbol{\mathrm{DAb}}$ of finite monoids whose regular $\mathcal{D}$-classes form Abelian groups. This combinatorial description yields a normal form for general pseudowords over $\boldsymbol{\mathrm{DAb}}$. For $(\omega - 1)$-terms, this normal form is computable, which yields an algorithm for the word problem for $(\omega - 1)$-terms of $\boldsymbol{\mathrm{DAb}}$.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Almeida, Manfred Kufleitner, Jan Philipp W\"achter

item.title: Connected components of the space of triples of transverse partial flags in $\mathrm{SO}_0(p,q)$ and Anosov representations
item.description: arXiv:2411.08679v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We count the number of connected components in the space of triples of transverse flags in any flag manifold of $\mathrm{SO}_0(p,q)$. We compute the effect the involution of the unipotent radical has on those components and deduce that for certain parabolic subgroups $P_{\Theta}$, any $P_{\Theta}$-Anosov subgroup is virtually isomorphic to either a surface group of a free group. We give examples of Anosov subgroups which are neither free nor surface groups for some sets of roots which do not fall under the previous results. As a consequence of the methods developed here, we get an explicit algorithm based on computation of minors to check if a unipotent matrix in $\mathrm{SO}_0(p,q)$ belong to the $\Theta$-positive semigroup $U_\Theta^{>0}$ when $p\neq q$.
item.dc:creator: Clarence Kineider, Rom\'eo Troubat

item.title: Pro-$p$ Poincar\'{e}-Duality groups of infinite rank
item.description: arXiv:2311.13992v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We introduce the class of \textit{Generalized Poincar\'{e}-Duality groups}: i.e, pro-$p$ groups of infinite rank which satisfy a Poincar\'{e}-duality. We prove some basic properties of Generalized Poincar\'{e}-Duality groups, and show that under some conditions, a group that fits into an exact sequence of GPD groups must be a Demushkin group.
item.dc:creator: Tamar Bar-On

item.title: Normalizer Quotients of Symmetric Groups and Inner Holomorphs
item.description: arXiv:2408.07133v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that every finite group $T$ is isomorphic to a normalizer quotient $N_{S_n}(H)/H$ for some $n$ and a subgroup $H\leq S_n$. We show that this holds for all large enough $n\ge n_0(T)$ and also with $S_n$ replaced by $A_n$. The two main ingredients in the proof are a recent construction due to Cornulier and Sambale of a finite group $G$ with $\mathrm{Out}(G)\cong T$ (for any given finite group $T$) and the determination of the normalizer in $\mathrm{Sym(G)}$ of the inner holomorph $\mathrm{InHol}(G)\leq\mathrm{Sym}(G)$ for any centerless indecomposable finite group $G$, which may be of independent interest.
item.dc:creator: Alexei Entin, Cindy Tsang

item.title: On the realization of subgroups of $PGL(2,F)$, and their automorphism groups, as Galois groups over function fields
item.description: arXiv:2109.06693v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $F$ be any field. We give a short and elementary proof that any finite subgroup $G$ of $PGL(2,F)$ occurs as a Galois group over the function field $F(x)$. We also develop a theory of descent to subfields of $F$. This enables us to realize the automorphism groups of finite subgroups of $PGL(2,F)$ as Galois groups.
item.dc:creator: Rod Gow, Gary McGuire
